title: Hotel New Hampshire (1984) StereoWidescr [Opt.Esp subs]
description:
<a href="http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0087428/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0087428/</a>

With Jodie Foster [then 22] and Rob Lowe [then 20]

Optional Spanish subtitles in separate idx/sub files.

Classic, burlesque humor with rape, sex and Sigmund Freud in person -- from John Irving, author of 'The Door in the Floor', 'The Cider House Rules' and 'The world according to Garp'.

This is my collector's item with the stereo widescreen version. Some error happened in the distribution so that only mono versions were made for European video distributors and TV/film channels. I had to order this edition especially from the U.S.

I read the novel after 'Garp' and had a hard time understanding which part of the plot took place where and why among these eccentric, sexually liberated family members, the Dancing Bear and the Farting Dog. When seeing the film, I finally understood that they moved to a revolutionary Europe AFTER the successful rape of Jodie Foster.

Impress your English literature teacher and see the film first! (You don't have to tell.)

Widescreen, good stereo, XviD Two-pass 608x448 AC3
Burn tested, runs well in my DivX player.
